block.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
block.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: a wall made of concrete blocks
block.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the distance along a city street from where one street crosses it to the next
block.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Head for 44th Street, a few blocks east of Sixth Avenue.
The church is down the block.
block.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the four city streets that form a square around an area of buildings
block.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: She grew up playing with the other kids on the block.
block.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: a ten-acre block near the city
block.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a large building divided into separate parts
block.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a quantity of things of the same kind, considered as a single unit
block.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: New employees receive a block of shares in the firm.
Set aside blocks of time for doing your homework.
block.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: the temporary loss of your normal ability to think, learn, write etc
block.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: I have a mental block whenever I try to remember my password.
After his second novel, Garland had writer’s block (=he could not write anything).
block.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: something that prevents movement or progress
block.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: a movement in sport that stops an opponent going forward or playing the ball forward
block.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 3: a large building divided into separate parts
block.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Three new blocks of flats were built on the land.
I met him at his apartment block in Manhattan.
She works in a 27-storey office block.
She lived on the 17th floor of a tower block in East London.
We had a tiny flat in an Edinburgh tenement block.
The area is full of monstrous concrete high-rise blocks.
Many shops and offices have been rebuilt in high multi-storey blocks.
block.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it
block.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: A fallen tree is blocking the road.
block.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to stop something happening, developing, or succeeding
block.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The Senate blocked publication of the report.
laws designed to block imports of cheap tobacco
block.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to stop light reaching a place
block.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Can you move? You’re blocking my light.
block.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to stop a ball, a blow etc from getting to where your opponent wants it to
block.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: a shot blocked by the goalkeeper
block.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a large number of shares in a particular company held by one owner or traded at one time. A block of shares usually involves 10,000 shares or more
block.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The company paid C$17.5 million to acquire a block of 1,224,489 shares.
A 10 million-share block trade in Avon at 39½ excited traders early in the day.
Wall Street’s best-known and most aggressive block trader
block.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a large building divided into separate parts
block.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: if a government or other authority blocks something, they prevent it happening, developing, or succeeding
block.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The French government blocked the import of New Zealand agricultural products into the Common Market.
